desc: It is a simple Ionic app.We are a medical center. We generate medical studies. When the process starts, we send a code to our customer. They can enter in a website and, with that code, check if the study is ready. If it is, they can download it. The project is about to create a mobile app to do the same.So, we need an Ionic app with just a screen where user can enter that code.It will call a PHP backend (also to be develop as part of this project) which will look for the study at certain path (lets say "/studies/<code>.pdf").If it is there, then sends it to the app, and this last one has to show it in another screen (not opening an external app).But, if the study is not yet ready (file doesn't exists), has to inform the user and, as soon and the file is copied to the path, send a notification to the app informing study is now available.When the app is opened again, having saved the previous code, has to call to the backend again, which now will return the study, and will show it.Thinks to keep in mind:1. Backend has to be develop as part of this project. It has to be in PHP 5.3 working with a MySQL database. Server runs linux.2. Studies are upload via ftp to a folder in the same server where the backend is running. It has to detect when a study is uploaded automatically (using iNotify) and then notify the app via push notifications.3. We want to use Ionic Services for the push notification service. App ideally should be make with Ionic, but is not mandatory.4. In any case, the app has to run in Android, iOS and Windows 10 mobile.So, what we expect to receive in order to consider the project fullfilled, and what would be our test cases:1) We recieve: a) Code of hybrid app with the functionalities mentioned. b) PHP code for the backend we need to make everything to work. c) File with the needed scripts to create the tables in a MySql db that the backed needs.What would we do to check everything is ok:1) Create a mysql database and run scripts provided2) Copy PHP to an Apache site.3) Take the code, modify the backend URL so it points to our test site, and deploy to an android device.4) Will copy a file "[url removed, login to view]" to a folder inside the backed, in the path the backend is checking for the studies.5) Will write the code 1234 in the android app. It has to call the backend, and then, since the file is there, has to download it and show to me inside an app screen.6). Will close the app. Open it again and write the code 5678.7) The app will check the backend, won't find the file, so will alert me that the file haven't yet been uploaded.8) I will copy a file "[url removed, login to view]" to the backend.9) The backend has to realize by itself that the file was uploaded, so will send a push notification to my phone.10) I will receive a notification in my phone. I will open the app again. It has to remember the last code I wrote, so as soon as it opens, will check the server again for the study. Now the backned has to return a file, and the open and show me (as it did in point 5).These steps are the one required to consider the project as completed.To send and receive notifications, you can create your own account in Ionic Services page, or we can create it and send you the credentials (note that, to send notification in android, you need to create a project in Google's Console).Also, as additional note, you can create if you wish the app in iOS. Our test will be done in Android anyway, but everything should run fine despite of it.
title: Write an Ionic application

desc: The App that I'm trying to put together involves people who work at hospitals that pay for parking. There are currently 3 ways to pay for parking:1) Going to the parking office on your break or after work and purchase days to park. There is almost always a massive line up and it will take very long to do so, leaving the worker frustrated from the experience and having no time for break.2) Calling the office to purchase days to park but there can be a long wait time being placed on hold before you speak to anyone.3) Having the hospital with draw a certain amount from your paycheck every so often, not helpful for people going on vacation and need that money. Those workers would have to go back to the office and tell them not to withdraw.In conclusion If this App were to be made, I believe that it will replace all three of these options that I have listed. There is already an App for ordering food at the food court so workers don't have to wait in line, why not for parking also.Thank you for your time.Sian
title: The project that I'm presenting involves an app on your phone for people that work in hospitals.

title: We are looking for Android + IOS developers in Telangana + Andhra Pradesh Regions Only..

desc: ABOUT YOU:You must be an experienced, professional and self-motivated person who can work remotely as part of a team. You must have a history of delivering quality, bug-free results and can prove it with work that can be viewed or downloaded.You must be willing to create a FREE working demo, from instructions, to showcase your skills and ability to deliver in a timely manner.You must be able to communicate in English.ABOUT THE PROJECT:The project includes an iOS app, Android app, API and web-based administration back end.The app has location-based features and an interface that are similar to Tinder, but it is not a dating app. It is free to use the basic version with the option of subscribing to unlock additional features just like Tinder. It also has a basic messaging system similar to Tinder. The app will incorporate advertising via AdMob for people who are not subscribers. Subscribers can turn the ads off etc, similar to the way Tinder works. If you are not confident that you could re-create something similar to the Tinder app or the web administration back end for the Tinder service then you should NOT apply for this project.The back end web administration site is based on Gmail’s UI so should have a dynamic jquery based interface. It should built using a common and reliable PHP framework like CodeIgnitor. The administration website should be built for multiple users who have different levels of permissions (Administrator, Subscriptions, Customer Service) which allows them to access different administrative features. The website and API should be able to run on distributed web servers, which means they should utilize a remote database and should also be capable of storing uploaded images/files etc on a remote server (which may or may not be housed in the same facility). I will provide you with a model and design structure to follow regarding the remote file storage (hashed images, SSH file transfer etc). The web services will be hosted on our own virtual cloud servers (Unix) at Rackspace.The MySQL database design is DONE.  I can also describe the basic structure of database queries to help with building the necessary API database queries etc.The UI design for both the app and administration website is also DONE. I can supply layered PSD files (created for iPhone 6+ screen size) for every screen of the app, and PNGs for every page of the web administration back end along with colours and font styles and sizes etc.You literally just need to follow my design EXACTLY and bring the idea to life. The design is NOT a "guide". The design IS the design. If you can’t tell the difference between something that looks CLOSE and something that is EXACTLY the same, please do NOT apply for this project. I do want to waste time pointing out blindingly obvious UI design mistakes when you have already been provided with something to COPY. I realize there are differences between the Android and iOS platforms, like with date pickers etc, and allowances will be made where these differences occur.I have already setup an Android Developers account, an Apple Developers account and an AdMob account ready for publishing.THE CONDITIONS:You must be willing to sign a non-disclosure agreement and agree that all tangible and intangible assets and intellectual property generated during the project development belongs to the client, without exception.You must provide a fixed price and timeline for completion of your part in the project based on the information I provide you. You must accept staged progress payments ON DELIVERY of work. There will be no up-front payments.You must agree to send ALL code, whether completed or in-progress, to the client at the end of every week before midnight on Friday. This can be via BitBucket or email or any other digital delivery method. Failure to deliver the code on any Friday may result in the immediate termination of your involvement in the project.
title: Hire an iPhone Developer
